results.title: Encounter with Saul Alinsky
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Barrie Howells, John Kemeny and Peter Pearson
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Challenge for change/Societe nouvelle”.
Part One of this film shows a lively confrontation between Saul Alinsky a professional activist, from the US whose efforts have been directed toward organising the poor, and several members of the Company of Young Canadians. In Part Two some young articulate Indians test their inherently tolerant philosophy against the more pragmatic ideas of Saul Alinsky. Peaceful persuasion is the means by which the Indians hope to bring about change while, contrastingly, Alinsky advocates a more direct development of power.

results.title: Encounter Bay
results.creator_credit: S A Government Tourist Bureau and Geoffrey Shepherd
results.brief_description: Encounter Bay, where the Murray River enters the sea, has a colorful history of whaling stations and ship wrecks. Bleached bones, rusty anchors, and museums remain to testify. Now Victor Harbour, Port Elliot, and Goolwa are popular holiday resorts. Luxurious accomodation, miles of surf beaches, golf courses, and natural beauty have made it a playground for people of all ages.

results.title: Encounter at Kwacha House - Halifax
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, John Kemeny, Barrie Howells and Rex Tasker
results.brief_description: A vociferous discussion between black and white youths at the interracial club in Halifax, touching on racial discrimination in employment, housing, education and interpersonal relations.

results.title: Encore! : the best of Joan Sutherland
results.brief_description: Dame Joan Sutherland, Australian icon and declared National Treasure, has been described as the foremost soprano of our age and one of the greatest artists of all time. Live from the Sydney Opera House, performed by the Elizabethan Sydney Orchestra and conducted by Richard Bongyne, this video contains highlights of her stage performances with Opera Australia, including many of her most internationally famous and highly acclaimed roles.

results.title: Enchanted isles
results.creator_credit: Anglo-Scottish Pictures and Films of Scotland Committee
results.brief_description: A tour of the Hebrides, starting from Oban and crossing the water to Iona, St Columba’s Isle, and to Staffa and Fingal’s cave. The birthplace of Flora MacDonald and memories of Bonnie Prince Charlie. Also shows the industry and agriculture of the islands, including the weaving of Harris tweed.

results.title: Enchanted April
results.creator_credit: BBC Film Unit, Miramax Films, Greenpoint, Ann Scott and Mike Newell
results.brief_description: In a beautifully played ensemble piece four Englishwomen desert their dull and oppressive lives in post World War I London and escape to the Italian Riviera for a months holiday in a majestic castle. Once there, the castle and its magnificent surroundings work a special magic on the four women. Each find their worries slowly disappearing, their personalities changing and together, the four discover a friendship unknown to the likes of any of them before. Stars Miranda Richardson, Joan Plowright, Polly Walker and Josie Lawrence. From the novel by Elizabeth Von Arnim.

results.title: Encaustic by Karl Zerbe
results.brief_description: This film explains that encaustic - hot wax used as a binder for pigment - is an ancient painting technique revised by Karl Zerbe in the late 1930’s. Follows the artist in the various steps from the laying of a collage ground on bare masonite through the final touches of blowtorch to the surface of the finished painting.
